dialog.profile.open.driver.not-found.des:
You don't have the needed drivers installed for connecting to this database server.
Install them in the driver manager.
main.title: DataBench v${version}
dialog.license.title: License Information
dialog.driver.download.title: Download JDBC Drivers
dialog.driver.download.description:
Select the database type and driver version you want to install.

The driver will be downloaded into the 'drivers' directory and
loaded automatically on the next application start.

Only official JDBC drivers are provided.
dialog.driver.download.progress.title: Downloading Driver
dialog.driver.download.success.title: Download Successful
dialog.driver.download.success.descripti: The ${dbtype} JDBC Driver version ${version} has been downloaded and installed successfully.
dialog.driver.download.error.title: Download Failed
dialog.driver.download.error.description:
Failed to download the ${dbtype} JDBC Driver version ${version}:
${error}
dialog.update.download.progress.title: Downloading Driver
dialog.update.download.success.title: Download Successful
dialog.update.download.success.descripti: The update has been downloaded successfully.
dialog.update.download.error.title: Download Failed
anonymous-data.text:
We would like to collect anonymous usage statistics to help improve DataBench. This data includes only a randomly generated installation ID and no personal information.

Your data will remain private and will be used solely for analytics.

Do you agree to send anonymous usage data?
dialog.export.title: Export
dialog.export.settings.title: Export Settings
dialog.export.console.title: Export Log
dialog.export.mode.desc.dbx:
Creates a .dbx archive containing schema, data and metadata.
Recommended for backups and migration.
dialog.export.mode.desc.mysql.single:
Exports all selected databases into one SQL dump file.
This method may lead to import issues.
dialog.export.mode.desc.mysql.folder:
Creates one SQL file per database in a target directory.
This method may lead to import issues.
dialog.export.choose.title: Choose export file
dialog.export.confirm.title: Confirm overwrite
dialog.export.confirm.overwrite:
The file already exists.
Do you want to overwrite it?
dialog.export.error.title: Export not ready
dialog.export.error.not_ready: Please select a project, at least one database and an export path.
